message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with the problem of learning an unknown distribution from lossy samples, which is a problem in information theory (cs.IT) and machine learning (cs.LG). The algorithmic aspect of the problem suggests that it could also belong to the categories of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS) and computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper's connection to learning DNFs suggests that it could also belong to the category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM).
